title: Jane Gardner is Emeritus Professor of Ancient History at the University of Reading and currently Special Professor in Classics at the University of Nottingham. Her published work covers many aspects of Roman literature and history. She is best known for her books on Roman social and legal history, Women in Ancient Law and Society
Being a Roman Citizen

container-title: She teaches in the Department of Classics at McMaster University
title: Michèle George is a Roman archaeologist who has published on the archaeological evidence for Roman slavery

container-title: Slenes teaches History at the Universidade Estadual de Campinas (UNICAMP), Brazil. His interest in travel literature and iconography stems from his research on nineteenth-century Brazilian slavery. His publications include a book on the slave family, Na Senzala
